content: Left wrist stiffness and limited range of motion
title: Chief Complaint

content: Patient is a stay-at-home mom who sustained a left distal radius fracture in October 2023 following a trip and fall. She underwent surgery (ORIF) on her left wrist with Dr. Andrew Rice. She was diagnosed with CRPS at the time of injury and post-op, but has made progress. She presents today for evaluation of persistent left wrist stiffness. She is unable to extend her wrist sufficiently to perform a push-up, although she can participate in Pilates regularly without pain or limitation, using modifications.
title: HPI Spencer

content: Incision is well healed. No tenderness to palpation. Excellent range of motion of the fingers and thumb. No swelling noted. Good grip strength.
title: Musculoskeletal

content: X-ray shows well-healed fracture with good alignment.
title: Imaging Results

content: Return to clinic in 4 weeks for follow-up.
title: Plan
